p: Soxhlet extraction is the conventional method of extraction; the selected solvent is heated to reflux and floods the solid material, extracting the desired compounds, including volatile compounds [ 140]. Many solvents have been successfully used to extract hemp seed oil with high yields. N-hexane and petroleum ether [ 141], dimethyl ether [ 142], ethanol [ 143] and isopropanol [ 144] have been used and optimized with regards to extraction time, temperature, and other extraction conditions.
